Pros: Company is doing well financially. This is reflected in paying out good bonuses recently. Overall, it's still a decent place to work.
Cons: There is no over-arching culture. Your experience is almost solely dictated by your department/manager. If you happen to work in a good department with a good manager, you'll probably enjoy working at BMC very much. If you're unfortunate and work in a department with a not-so-good leader, you're going to have a pretty miserable experience!

Pros: One of the reasons I love working at BMC is because they truly care about their employees. There are hundreds of programs to fit the needs of every individual and we are always encouraged to reach out when it's warranted. BMC has some of the best healthcare options I have experienced in my occupational career, and they are always willing to listen and determine the best course of action to make sure their employees have everything they need. There are also a ton of opportunities to move around the company if you wish and I have found my management to be incredibly supportive of growth in any form, so there is no backlash to ambition.
Cons: I don't have any true downsides to working with BMC, I guess I would say that the experience you have is what you make of it. The energy you put in to working at BMC is what you are going to get out of it. BMC has a net positive/neutral environment to work with, so if you give it your best to communicate and work towards your ambitions, you won't have any problems.

Review Title: Very toxic place to be at
Pros: Pros are the history that this environment carries. I did not see any other pros.
Cons: No work life balance. Dirty office politics. They will pay employees high money because they don't trust their employees. Poor management threatens employees in the name of cost cutting so that they will not ask for anything else. A sense of status quo even when the market share is being lost. People are highly stressed out in their job which means the company culture is not good. They have people working in there for 10 -15 years and hence they lack the outlook of outside world. They don't hire inexperienced people and ask existing employees to check with family members and friends about what other organisations are doing. They hire contractors and treat them like second class citizens. Appraisals are sole discretion of Managers so they will raise pay for whomever they like. Management is very arrogant and won't listen to their shortcomings. And the list will go on.

Review Title: Top Notch - Leadership that trust and enable

Cons: Working in office policy needs some adjusting, most positions can be done remotely and at max hybrid yet there is a general push to be present in office which for the long commuters ain't enjoyable, need to get with the times and employee experience.

Review Title: Success is not being evenly distributed...
Pros: The work is interesting and BMC is going places without a doubt. The business is booming with amazing sales and products others would die for. ServiceNow is being left in the dust.
Cons: Stagnant wages and a workforce looking for the door. There is already a 50% staff attrition in sales annually, so most of the sales team don't know anything about the products. Staff get well below inflation wage rises(so that is a wage cut).

Pros: Remote work Flexible Working Hours Respect for the Individual
